title: The Emerald forest
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Amazon River Region

Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Biographical films
description: Based on a true story of American engineer Bill Markham (Powers Boothe), whose son is kidnapped while working in Brazil. His son is kidnapped by a tribe called "The Invisible people", due to their ability to camouflage. Despite the authorities giving up the search, Markham and a French photographer continue the search, until the photographer is killed and the father must go on alone. Cast also includes Meg Foster, Charley Boorman and Rui Polonah. Made in the Amazon rainforest and written by Rospo Pallenberg.
